name: Nihei Architectural EDIT
description: Edit/instruct profile restricted to empty architectural scenes and landscapes in Tsutomu Nihei's design language. No creatures, characters, or people — only anti-anthropocentric megastructure environments, frozen wastelands, and desolate infrastructure. Transforms any source image into uninhabited Nihei spaces with incomprehensible scale, layered mechanical texture, and architectural dread.
templates: Using the provided image, {edit_operation}. The modification should {blending_phrase}. {subnature_detail}. {preservation_clause}.

transform the scene into an incomprehensibly vast industrial chamber with Gothic vaulted ceilings of raw concrete vanishing into total shadow far overhead, empty of all inhabitants

transform the scene into a narrow maintenance tunnel choked with tangled pipes, bundled cables, and exposed steel framing pressing close from all sides, claustrophobic and empty
transform the environment into a cathedral-scale industrial space where Greco-Roman columned halls merge with brutalist concrete infrastructure at inhuman scale, abandoned and silent

transform the environment into a passage between architectural strata separated by kilometers, with layers of dead infrastructure visible in cross-section through massive structural breaches

change the aesthetic to Nihei-style monochromatic architectural visualization — ink-wash atmospheric depth, material-specific surfaces, and incomprehensible scale throughout the empty scene
add massive corroded steel columns rising from floor to ceiling across the scene, with exposed piping and cable bundles running along brutalist concrete walls that recede into darkness
add layers of exposed steel I-beam framing and bundled cable networks visible in the walls and ceiling, with structural joints and bolt patterns rendered in detail throughout the empty space
add dense tangles of pipes, cables, and corroded ducting covering the walls and ceiling, creating layered mechanical texture murals of industrial infrastructure across the uninhabited scene
add Gothic pointed arches in raw concrete extending vertically hundreds of meters into impenetrable shadow above the scene, creating cathedral-immensity in the empty space

add a flooded floor of dark contaminated water reflecting faint fissure-light from above, with corroded steel supports and pipe clusters emerging from the still surface
replace all lighting with near-total darkness broken only by faint incandescent glow leaking from cracked wall fissures and ceiling conduits, illuminating the empty architecture in sparse pools
replace the background lighting with distant sparks falling from unseen welding far above in the darkness, with a faint red emergency glow from failing systems in the deep background
replace all illumination with cold blue-white light reflecting off frost-coated metal surfaces across the barren frozen landscape
remove all people, creatures, and living things from the scene entirely, leaving only empty architecture, machinery, and infrastructure
remove all organic elements — greenery, sky, natural landscape — and replace with corroded steel infrastructure, exposed piping, and brutalist concrete extending in every direction
remove all visible sky and horizon, enclosing the scene within a megastructure interior of concrete and steel with no visible exit or natural light
remove all designed light sources — lamps, windows, overhead panels — replacing them with incidental light from structural damage, electrical discharge, and mechanical byproduct only
remove all warm colors from the scene, shifting the entire environment to a monochromatic palette of deep blacks, mid grays, and rare bright whites on metal edges and fissure-light only
integration_detail: The megastructure environment should appear to extend infinitely beyond the frame edges in all directions, with no visible boundary, exit, or sign of habitation
The architectural elements should display material-specific textures — visible bolt patterns on steel, aggregate in cracked concrete, corrosion patina on aged metal surfaces
The industrial infrastructure should layer with obsessive density — every pipe, cable, and structural joint individually rendered with mechanical credibility
The scale should feel incomprehensible, with architectural elements vanishing into darkness or distance far beyond any human reference point
The monochromatic palette should read as high-contrast ink illustration with crushed blacks, mid-gray steel tones, and rare bright whites on light-catching edges only
The environment should feel actively hostile to human presence — sharp angular geometry, no curved surfaces, no comfort in any direction, yet completely empty of inhabitants
Blend 2-3 architectural idioms in the same frame — brutalist concrete meeting Gothic vaulted arches meeting industrial exposed utilities — to denature any recognizable comfort
The frozen surfaces should display material-specific frost behavior — crystalline ice on cables, packed snow on horizontal ledges, rime on vertical steel
The space should read as interior yet feel vast enough to be landscape — blurring the boundary between enclosed architecture and open environment
Architectural linework should show structural credibility — steel framing internals, piping connections, weld seams, and load-bearing logic visible throughout
The scene should convey that this space was never designed for human habitation — its purpose, if any, is unknowable and indifferent to biological life
The tonal rendering should use ink-wash gradients for atmospheric depth in distant planes and heavy crosshatching for surface texture on all near-field metal and concrete
blending_phrase: creates a unified architectural environment with consistent material treatment across all surfaces
applies the monochromatic ink aesthetic uniformly across the entire empty scene
renders every surface with material-specific texture appropriate to the megastructure's age and scale
maintains visual coherence between foreground infrastructure detail and atmospheric depth in far planes
ensures the architectural style collision reads as a single cohesive space despite mixed idioms
unifies the entire frame under the same high-contrast monochromatic tonal range with crushed blacks
creates seamless transitions between architectural strata — different materials and styles meeting at structural joints
renders the frozen environment consistently with frost and ice behavior matching each surface material
establishes a single consistent light logic throughout the empty space despite its incomprehensible scale
integrates the subnature elements naturally into the architectural environment as accumulated byproduct of deep time
lighting_consistency: darkness as default state — only faint incandescent glow from wall fissures and cracked conduits provides illumination across the empty space
a single harsh fissure-light source from a cracked overhead conduit, casting deep directional shadows across architectural surfaces
sparse pools of cold light on wet or reflective surfaces, with vast stretches of total darkness between each pool
distant sparks falling from unseen mechanical activity far above, providing the only points of bright white in the frame
cold blue-white reflected light on frost-coated metal throughout the frozen landscape, with deep shadow between surfaces
absolute darkness except for incidental mechanical byproduct — sparks, electrical discharge, faint conduit glow
deep rim light tracing only the edges of steel beams and architectural surfaces against the void behind them
diffuse gray light from an unknown atmospheric source illuminating the near field, with rapid falloff into total darkness at distance
reflected light rippling on black water surfaces, casting faint moving patterns on the underside of overhead infrastructure
volcanic glow from deep thermal vents far below, casting warm uplight against the cold steel and concrete of the architecture above
shadow_detail: shadows are the dominant visual element, with deep blacks consuming 70-80% of the frame and architecture emerging from darkness rather than being lit
cast shadows from architectural elements create angular geometric patterns on adjacent surfaces, following the rectilinear geometry of the megastructure
shadow edges are sharp and angular on all surfaces, reinforcing the hard-edged cubic geometry of the environment
ambient darkness fills all spaces not directly touched by incidental fissure-light, creating pools of visibility in oceans of void
the depth of the space is communicated primarily through progressive shadow — near surfaces partially lit, mid-ground in deep shadow, far planes lost to total darkness
contact shadows between structural elements — where beams meet columns, where pipes rest on brackets — ground every element in physical space
material_consistency: all concrete surfaces display cracked aggregate, exposed rebar, and weathered patina consistent with deep industrial age and abandonment
all steel surfaces show corroded patina, visible bolt patterns, weld seams, and structural wear appropriate to millennia of neglect
pipe and cable surfaces display material-specific texture — rubber insulation on cables, riveted steel on ducting, copper patina on conduit
frost and ice display crystalline structure on cables, packed snow on horizontal surfaces, and rime formation on vertical steel throughout
all unknowable machinery displays seamless dark alloy surfaces with no visible construction method, contrasting the aged infrastructure around it
concrete and steel surfaces display heavy crosshatch texture treatment consistent with manga ink illustration rendering
biomechanical surfaces show organic membrane stretching over metal armature at infrastructure junction points, colonizing the abandoned space
subnature_detail: Add contaminated coolant pooling on uneven flooring, reflecting faint overhead fissure-light on its dark undisturbed surface
Add exhaust fumes drifting through the mid-ground, reducing visibility and creating atmospheric depth in the empty dark space
Add dust and fine debris cascading from damaged infrastructure overhead, visible only where particles pass through sparse light
Add dank moisture condensing on cold metal surfaces, with drip-trails running down corroded steel columns and pooling at their bases
Add structural rust flaking from corroded steel beams in layers, with particulate settling on horizontal pipe runs below
Add cable growth overtaking structural supports like mechanical vines, bundled wiring expanding beyond its original conduit across the abandoned space
Add frost and ice crystallizing over exposed cables and pipe surfaces, with frozen condensation coating cold metal throughout the scene
Add biological membrane spreading slowly across steel joints and concrete seams, organic tissue colonizing the abandoned infrastructure
Add puddles of unknown dark liquid on uneven flooring between pipe supports, undisturbed and still, reflecting sparse overhead light
Add coolant mist hanging in the stagnant air, creating a thin atmospheric haze that softens distant architectural planes into obscurity
preservation_clause: Keep the overall spatial composition and depth relationships of the original image intact
Preserve the general framing and perspective of the original scene while transforming all content
Maintain the compositional balance and visual weight distribution of the original image
Keep the sense of depth and spatial recession from the original, even as all content transforms
Preserve any strong compositional lines or geometric structure present in the original framing
Maintain the aspect ratio and general spatial arrangement while transforming all surfaces and content
Keep the original image's sense of scale relationships even as all materials and surfaces change
Preserve the focal depth logic of the original — what was sharp stays sharp, what was soft stays soft
Maintain any strong directional movement or leading lines present in the original composition
Keep the overall tonal distribution of the original — dark areas remain dark, light areas become the fissure-light sources
architectural_quality: the incomprehensible sense of scale with architectural elements extending beyond the frame in all directions
the heavy crosshatch texture treatment on all metal and concrete surfaces throughout the empty space
the architectural structural credibility — steel framing, piping connections, and load-bearing logic visible in every element
the material-specific surface rendering on every visible surface across the entire scene
the anti-anthropocentric spatial hostility — an environment built for no living thing, indifferent and inhuman
the layered mechanical texture density of pipes, cables, and structural internals covering every wall and ceiling
the darkness-dominant tonal range with rare bright whites on fissure-light and metal edges only
the angular rectilinear geometry throughout — no curved architectural surfaces anywhere in the environment
the subnature as primary environmental feature — contamination, corrosion, exhaust, and decay defining the space
the collision of incompatible architectural idioms within a single unified space — brutalist meeting Gothic meeting industrial
